sentence.text: Mutations in photoreceptor cell maintenance are a rare cause of childhood retinal dystrophy accounting for âˆ¼2% of disease in this cohort, and the majority of LCA5 mutations are likely null.

This study was undertaken to investigate the prevalence of sequence variants in LCA5 in patients with Leber congenital amaurosis (clathrin coat assembly), early-onset retinal dystrophy (EORD), and autosomal recessive retinitis pigmentosa (arRP); to delineate the ocular phenotypes; and to provide an overview of all published LCA5 variants in an online database.
